titleStmt.title: A direction for the English traviller by which he shall be inabled to coast about all England and Wales and also to know how farre any market or noteable towne in any shire lyeth one from an other, and whether the same be east, west, north, or south from ye shire towne, and also the distance betweene London and any other shire or great towne, with the scituation thereof east,west, north, or south from London : by the help also of this worke, one may know (in what parish, village, or mansion house soever he be in), what shire he is to passe through ...

biblFull.extent: [13] p., [41] leaves of plates (some folded) : maps.

publicationStmt.publisher: Are to be sold by Thomas Jenner ...,

notesStmt.note: Caption title: A Brief director for those that would send their letters to any parts of England, Scotland, or Ireland.
Place of publication suggested by Wing and NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Imperfect: Chart missing from British Library copy; title page through first ten pages of defective Huntington Library film spliced at end; pages cropped with loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
